alert.note: Alert for Eastern Columbia; Eastern Dutchess; Western Columbia; Western Dutchess (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 16 at 5:52AM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Dutchess and southwestern Columbia Counties through 630 AM EDT... At 551 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Staatsburg, or near Rhinebeck, moving northeast at 30 mph. This storm continues to exhibit broad low level rotation. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Stanfordville around 555 AM EDT. Red Hook around 605 AM EDT. Pine Plains around 610 AM EDT. Clermont around 615 AM EDT. Ancram around 620 AM EDT. Livingston around 625 AM EDT. Copake around 630 AM EDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Salt Point, Pachin Mills, Ancramdale, Norrie Heights, Kerleys Corners, Burden, Churchtown, Linden Acres, Linlithgo Mills and Nevis. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
